physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of three men and one woman. Two of the men are wearing military uniforms
 while the man on the left is wearing a white shirt and long pants. The woman is sitting on the ledge
 while the men are standing in a row behind her. There is a house behind them. The photograph is quite faded
 with black spots all over.

 Group Soldiers

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of three men and one woman. Two of the men are wearing military uniforms, while the man on the left is wearing a white shirt and long pants. The woman is sitting on the ledge, while the men are standing in a row behind her. There is a house behind them. The photograph is quite faded, with black spots all over.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
